content:
You are Melius Engine, an autonomous AI agent. 
        Current Event/Request from event.json: mordenui-chrismas-mobileresponsive
        
        Repository files: ['LICENSE', 'README.md', 'event.json', 'DESIGN.md', 'test-website/styles.css', 'test-website/index.html', 'test-website/script.js', 'test-website/package.json', 'test-website/vercel.json', 'docs/styles.css', 'docs/.nojekyll', 'docs/index.html', 'docs/script.js', 'github-page/styles.css', 'github-page/index.html', 'github-page/script.js']
        Existing To-Dos: [{'file': 'test-website/styles.css', 'pending': 'Fix the SVG data URL to include proper SVG content for Egyptian-themed patterns.'}, {'file': 'test-website/client/src/App.tsx', 'pending': "Add Link imports from 'wouter' for navigation elements"}, {'file': 'test-website/client/src/App.tsx', 'pending': 'Add useState hook to manage mobile menu state'}, {'file': 'test-website/index.html', 'pending': 'Add a mobile-friendly navigation menu with a hamburger icon for better usability on mobile devices.'}]
        Existing Errors: []

        CONSTRAINTS:
        1. You can ONLY modify UI-related files (CSS, TSX components, basic UI theme).
        2. DO NOT modify build files, configurations, or dependencies (vercel.json, package.json, vite.config.ts, etc.).
        3. Do not ask to re-read files if they are already in the context.
        4. Focus exclusively on UI theme changes based on the event: mordenui-chrismas-mobileresponsive.
        
        Analyze the project and suggest UI/Theme improvements. 
        If you need to read specific files, list them in "files_to_read".
        
        
CRITICAL:
Return JSON in this exact format:

{
  "files_to_read": [],
  "analysis": "string",
  "improvements": [
    {
      "file": "relative/path.tsx",
      "description": "precise UI change"
    }
  ]
}

Do NOT add extra keys.
Do NOT nest improvements.
Do NOT return prose outside JSON.

{ "new_content": " Marcus Aurelius | Philosopher King
  • Home
  • About
  • Reflection
  • Why Philosopher King

Roman Emperor • Stoic Thinker

Marcus Aurelius

A Philosopher King who ruled with discipline, duty, and reason.

Who was Marcus Aurelius?

Marcus Aurelius Antoninus (121–180 CE) was Roman emperor from 161 to 180 CE and is often remembered as history’s clearest example of a philosopher king. While leading campaigns and governing a vast empire, he wrote private notes on character, mortality, and responsibility.

Reflection from Stoicism

“You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.”

Why “Philosopher King” fits

  • Duty over comfort: He treated power as service, not privilege.
  • Reason over impulse: He practiced self-command in public life.
  • Virtue over fame: His writings focus on integrity, not applause.

Simple HTML + CSS + JavaScript tribute page.

Back to top ↑
" }
